TextView.android:text: Balance is key and learning to listen to your body and balancing what feels right with what’s good for you. Aim to make breakfast a part of your routine. Choose complex carbohydrates, lean protein sources, healthy fats, and a wide variety of fruits and veggies. Stock your fridge and gym bag with healthy workout snacks.

Don’t cut too many calories If you’re trying to lose weight, you may be tempted to cut a ton of calories from your meals. Cutting calories is a key part of weight loss, but never go too far.
Weight loss diets should never leave you feeling exhausted or ill. Those are signs that you’re not getting the calories you need for good health and fitness.
According to the National Heart, Lung, and Blood InstituteTrusted Source, a diet containing 1,200 to 1,500 daily calories is suitable for most women who are trying to lose weight safely. A diet with 1,500 to 1,800 daily calories is appropriate for most men who are trying to shed excess pounds.
Boost your fruit and vegetable intake :Bananas,Berries, grapes, oranges, nuts and Choose healthy fats Healthy options include: nuts seeds avocados olives oils, such as olive oil, peanut butter

Pack protein into your snacks and meals.Protein can come from: poultry, such as chicken and turkey red meat, such as beef and lamb fish, such as salmon and tuna dairy, such as milk and yogurt legumes, such as beans and lentils eggs

Your first meal of the day is an important one.Follow these tips for a healthy breakfast: Instead of eating sugar-laden cereals, try oatmeal, oat bran, or other whole-grain cereals high in fiber. Throw in some protein, such as milk, yogurt, or chopped nuts. Then, stir some cottage cheese into the batter. If you prefer toast, choose whole-grain bread. Then pair it with an egg, peanut butter, or another protein source.
